title: Alison Hammond has This Morning fans in stitches with VERY cheeky innuendo about her 'large melons'
text:
She is well known for her bubbly personality and humorous quips while presenting on the ITV daytime show.

And Alison Hammond was on fine form once again as she left This Morning viewers in stitches during Friday's installment of the programme.

The TV star, 44, was presenting a segment from Foxes pumpkin patch when she made a very tongue-in-cheek remark about her 'large melons' when explaining the origins of a pumpkin.

Cheeky: Alison Hammond was on fine form once again as she left This Morning viewers in stitches during Friday's installment of the programme

Catching the eye in a bright green jacket and fedora hat, Alison looked in a jovial mood as she presented her link, while hosts Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford watched on from the studio.

Beginning her segment, she said: 'Welcome to Foxes farm! Let me give you a little fun fact about pumpkins.'

She then went on to make her cheeky remark, explaining: 'Did you know, pumpkin comes from the Greek word pepons, which means large melons. So if I told you I have two pepons you know what I’m talking about!

After saying her eye-raising joke, the former Big Brother star gave a knowing look the camera, while Ruth exclaimed: 'We do now!'

Innuendo: The TV star, 44, was presenting a segment from Foxes pumpkin patch when she made a very tongue-in-cheek remark about the vegetable when explaining its origins

Alison's naughty innuendo not only left Ruth and Eamonn tickled, but the viewers at home as well, with several fans tweeting their response on Twitter.

While some remarked on how funny she was., one even suggested that bosses need to give her a pay rise.

This isn't the only time Alison has left viewers in stitches over her hilarious on-air antics.

Just last month she was left devastated after Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson dumped her after two years of 'marriage' for his partner Lauren Hashian.

Following the news that the actor had tied the knot, viewers witnessed the roving reporter drown her sorrows in her dressing room.

Fun: Catching the eye in a green jacket and fedora hat, Alison was jovial as she presented her link, while hosts Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford watched on from the studio

Haha: 'Pumpkin comes from the Greek word pepons, which means large melons. So if I told you I have two pepons you know what I’m talking about!'

Hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby desperately tried to console Alison after announcing the tragic 'split,' before vowing to launch a Birmingham-wide search to find her a new man.

The tragic news of Alison's split came after The Rock tied the knot with his long-term partner Lauren Hashian in Hawaii.

It was a shocking union for many fans, who were aware of his 'marriage' to Alison in late 2017.

Amused: Alison's naughty innuendo not only left Ruth and Eamonn tickled, but the viewers at home as well, with several fans tweeting their response on Twitter

The pair exchanged vows during a press junket for Jumanji after Alison arrived in a wedding dress, with The Rock's co-star Kevin Hart acting as an officiant.

When asked about his relationship with Alison, The Rock sadly admitted their 'marriage' was over, saying at the D23 Expo last month: 'Alison, I'm sorry, I got married.'

His Jungle Cruise co-star Emily Blunt added: 'He's serving you the papers!' with the Rock affirming the statement by adding: 'I am serving you the papers now...' but winked at the camera as he said he would 'call her tonight.'

Cutting back to the studio, Alison stuffed her face with popcorn, and wailed: 'I don't understand why he would have done this to me, that's all.

'I just feel so let down. I did kind of know [about his girlfriend], but we were married - I had a ring and everything. I didn't see him very often but I knew we were in love with each other.'

They're over! This Morning fans were devastated to receive the news that Alison Hammond had 'split' from Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson on Tuesday
